title: Highland Gold slashes interim dividend as profit plunges on lower gold prices

Wed, Sep 23, 2015, 17:14 BST - UK Markets closed Highland Gold slashes interim dividend as profit plunges on lower gold prices By Daniel Cancian | Sharecast – 20 minutes ago 11.25 0.00 
LONDON (ShareCast) - (ShareCast News) - Highland Gold Mining (Other OTC: HGHGF - news ) posted a sharp fall in interim profit, as higher sales and lower costs failed to offset a decline in gold prices. In the first six months of 2015, the Russia-focused miner posted a 43.5% year-on-year decline in pre-tax profit to $16.6m (£10.88m), while revenue fell 8% to $130.7m (£85.2m). 
As a result, the group slashed its interim dividend by 20% to 0.020p per share. 
Earnings before interest, tax, depreciation and amortisation rose 13.4% year-on-year to $54.9m, driven higher by an increase in margin, which rose from 34% to 42%, and by the devaluation of the rouble. 
Gold (Other OTC: GDCWF - news ) production increased 1% to 121, 242 ounces, while sales rose 2.3% to 119,277 ounces, but that was offset by a 10% year-on-year decline in the price of gold, which fell to $1,088 per ounce. 
Highland shares were down 3.15% to 53.75p at 1536 BST on Wednesday.
